intro: Zilla myagrum, commonly known as the narrowleaf zilla, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, triangular leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually greenish-white and appear in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. Zilla myagrum is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun.
